message.content: Now let me fix the performance issue in the backend by avoiding the redundant network call:

function.name: str_replace_editor

content:
The file /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py has been edited. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py:
   881	        invalidate_tab_feeds_cache(feed.tab_id)
   882	        logger.info(f"Cache invalidated for tab {feed.tab_id} after updating feed {feed.id}.")
   883	
   884	        # Trigger update to fetch new items using the already fetched feed data
   885	        try:
   886	            if parsed_feed:
   887	                # Reuse the already fetched and parsed feed data to process entries,
   888	                # avoiding a redundant network call.
   889	                process_feed_entries(feed, parsed_feed)
   890	        except Exception as update_e:
   891	            # Log error during update but don't fail the operation
   892	            logger.error(f"Error updating feed {feed.id} after URL change: {update_e}", exc_info=True)
   893	        
   894	        logger.info(f"Updated feed {feed_id} from '{original_url}' to '{new_url}'.")
   895	        
   896	        # Return full feed data including items for frontend to update widget
   897	
Review the changes and make sure they are as expected. Edit the file again if necessary.

extras.diff:
--- /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py
+++ /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py
@@ -884 +884 @@
-        # Trigger update to fetch new items.
+        # Trigger update to fetch new items using the already fetched feed data
@@ -886 +886,4 @@
-            fetch_and_update_feed(feed.id)
+            if parsed_feed:
+                # Reuse the already fetched and parsed feed data to process entries,
+                # avoiding a redundant network call.
+                process_feed_entries(feed, parsed_feed)
